sentence.idiomatic: Domestically this industry got a relatively late start, so there are still a lot of growth opportunities.

word.literal: to be unable to compare with

sentence.idiomatic: Our company is just starting up, it can't compare in scale with those large companies.
These two sports started at the same time, however they developed entirely differently.
This project has huge potential. It's worth investing in.
Among the several young people new here, I think Wang has the most potential.
This region is already pretty much developed. There's not much potential.
The small house he constructed has been torn down by the management.
The basic framework of the website has already been done.
There are two days left until the show opens, but the stage hasn't been built yet.
Speaking with him, I found that his thinking patterns were very unique.
The original management model doesn't suit the growth of the company anymore. We need to make necessary adjustments.
There is a set format for writing press releases. Just follow that and it will be fine.
She is quite single-minded when it comes to love. Once she falls for a person, she can't let go.
Don't be so stubborn. You can't do it this way--try something else.
The way he does things and deals with problems is too inflexible. He doesn't know how to be flexible.
When facing frustrations, one must stay calm.
When he was building his business he encountered many setbacks, but he never gave up.
After going through each setback, he became stronger.
This year the company has made outstanding achievements.
Our team made the most outstanding achievements in the company this month.
Today we want to hold a meeting to discuss the issue of how to accomplish more in the company.
Nowadays competition is so fierce, we have to develop new areas of our business.
Recently the company accepted a big work contract. Everyone is going to start getting busy again.
Our manager went out to discuss business. Call back a little later.

Mr. Ma, thank you for accepting an interview with Finance and Economics Daily. Your company is now China's biggest e-commerce enterprise, yet it is said that when you undertook this venture, you knew nothing about the internet.
Yes. At that time, the internet was just getting started in China. However, I was convinced that it had huge potential.
How is it that you chose e-commerce? At the time, a lot of people were doing portal websites.

I've always felt that the biggest function of the internet is to bring people together. So, why not use it for business? That's why I wanted to set up that kind of a platform; to connect the seller with the buyer.
Your business model has really achieved success now. But at the time, there wasn't a single person willing to invest in it, isn't that right?
Yes. My concept was comparatively ahead of its time, a lot of people didn't believe in it. However, I'm quite a stubborn person. If others didn't want to invest, I would do it on my own!
What was the biggest frustration you ran into?

There were many. The main thing was that the market was not accustomed to this kind of model, therefore there was no business. The company kept burning up money. But the internet developed very quickly, and soon afterward, everyone started giving e-commerce a try. Furthermore, we were able to link up merchants both at home and abroad. This definitely was of benefit to them.
Now, the company has achieved a lot--last year it successfully went public. Why have you not expanded the scope of the business to include online games, search engines?
Because I'm stubborn! We currently have a B2B transaction website, we also have an auction website. We want to make these the best they can be.
I've heard that your ideal is to have your business revenue surpass that of Walmart.
He he, it's not an ideal, it's a goal. I hope to realize that goal during my time here.

word.literal: to become listed on the stock market
